Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: I noticed that events 1-3 have consistently low sensor readings for temperature, pressure, vibration, material flow, and energy. This pattern indicates the preparation phase or warm-up phase.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: From events 4-7, a significant increase in temperature (above 50Â°C), material flow, and energy usage suggests that this phase is active processing. Based on the pattern, I deduced this corresponds to a cutting phase.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Event 8 shows a noticeable drop in material flow and energy while maintaining normal temperature and pressure. This matches a pattern of cooldown or break phase.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Event 9 shows a significant spike in vibration (50Hz) and energy usage (5.00 kWh) while material flow is zero. This suggests a potential transition to a new phase of processing, possibly welding or moving to the next stage.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Events 10-12 match the pattern of low sensor readings similar to events 1-3, suggesting the start of a new operational cycle. This confirms the earlier interpretation of cyclic behavior in the process.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Events 13-15 mirror the sensor readings and conditions seen in the initial preparation phase, further supporting the conclusion of cyclicity in the manufacturing process.
